pullRequest.title: Ignore ALREADY_EXISTS error from the connector in CREATE SCHEMA
pullRequest.bodyText:
CreateSchemaTask should ignore the ALREADY_EXISTS error from the connector createSchema() call, as is done in CreateTableTask.
See: #3811

nodes.bodyText: default visibility will be enough. Drop public.
No need to create two CreateSchema objects. Those are immutable.

Please move the assertions to test methods. And be more specific where we expect an exception.
What about getting rid of duplicateCreateSchema and having createSchema method instead which just executes the statement.
Then this test method would look like this:
   createSchema("test_db", false);
   assertEquals(metadata.getCreateSchemaCount(), 1);
   assertThatExceptionOfType(PrestoException.class)
            .isThrownBy(() -> crateSchema("test_db", false))
            .withMessage(".....")
Explicityl call createSchema twice here and have assertions here.

Please change it to use AssertJ assertion and validate that exception message actually says about duplicate schema.
Here is an example: https://github.com/prestosql/presto/blob/7d2d9db8130f76a1d9f7814c1ce61d810fdc6864/presto-parquet/src/test/java/io/prestosql/parquet/TestTupleDomainParquetPredicate.java#L137

Reformat to:
        assertThatExceptionOfType(PrestoException.class)
                .isThrownBy(() -> getFutureValue(new CreateSchemaTask().internalExecute(statement, metadata, new AllowAllAccessControl(), testSession, emptyList())))
                .withMessage("Schema already exists");

commit.message:
Ignore ALREADY_EXISTS error from the connector in CREATE SCHEMA

Ignore ALREADY_EXIST errors returned by CreateSchemaTask errors on CREATE SCHEMA ... IF NOT EXISTS.

afterCommit.message:
Ignore ALREADY_EXISTS error from the connector in CREATE SCHEMA
